abstracts.cdata!:
The project ratings are as follows:
            Project outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development project is modest; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Some lessons learnt from the project: included
            1) the need for interagency cooperation at border cross
            points to sustain changes and promote pragmatic approaches
            in problem resolution; 2) the multiplying effect of economic
            returns that come from replicating procedures at pilot
            sites; 3) the frequent rotation of staff in the General
            Directorate of Customs that made it difficult for the
            organization to "own" the project, and contributed
            to project delays; 4) the better results in detecting
            irregularities that come with customs control; 5) the need
            for further cooperation and support from government agencies
            to make the regional website sustainable and successful; 6)
            designing border inspection facilities as multifunctional so
            they could be adapted for other uses after their current use
            becomes no more relevant; 7) the need for the Bank to focus
            on legitimate security arrangements and anti-terrorism
            aspects as well as trade facilitation; 8) the fact that
            project was result-oriented  with measurable indicators
            contributed to project success; 9) the importance of
            starting the policy dialogue at the very beginning of the
            project; and 10) achieving better project results by
            adopting a regional approach, which creates peer pressure
            among participating countries and generates competitive
            spirit and motivation, leading to better performance.
